intro: Frantzia pittieri var. quinqueloba, commonly known as the five-lobed frantzia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive five-lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
